==Translingual==
{{ja-forms|[[体]]|[[体]]|[[體]]}}

===Etymology===
In its traditional sense ("inferior") — {{Han compound|人|本|c1=s|c2=p|alt1=亻|t1=person|ls=psc}}.

As a simplification of [[體]] ("body") — {{Han compound|人|本|alt1=亻|t1=person|t2=basis|ls=ic}}.

===Han character===
{{Han char|rn=9|rad=人|as=05|sn=7|four=25230|canj=ODM|ids=⿰亻本}}

# [[body]] {{qualifier|as simplification of 體}}
# [[group]], [[class]], [[body]], [[unit]] {{qualifier|as simplification of 體}}
# [[inferior]] {{qualifier|as traditional 体}}

====Usage notes====
Readings as traditional 体 (inferior):
* ''ban6'' (Cantonese), ''bèn'' (Mandarin), ''bun'' (Korean), or ''hon'' (Japanese).
Readings as simplification of 體 (body, group):
* Cantonese ''tai2'', Mandarin ''tǐ'' , Korean ''che'', Japanese ''tei'' and ''tai'', and Vietnamese ''thể''.
